content.description: A steep start leads to easier, but delicate climbing to anchor.  Look for the shell fossils in the rock at the bottom.
content.location: Below the large ledge on the left side of the Molars,  below the large tooth that holds Iron Horse / Born to Lose.

content.description:
Beautiful seam above the "Les Lives" graffiti. Route name inspired by the artist.

This is an incredible route,  get on it.   Juggy moves lead to an undercling sequence to a rest followed by a boulder move to a finishing jug.

A fun rope swing can be set up on this route if you bring some long slings for the top anchor
Steep, bouldery right leaning seam to a jug,  flake to the a ledge,  and shallow crack to the top.  Crux is getting to the jug.
content.protection: 4 draws,  bring long slings if top roping (rock is hollow near the lip)
content.location: Next route to the right of Heart of Stone near the center of the crag.

content.description: Short and steep climbing through big, juggy moves to a thin finish.
content.location: Second route from the far right side of the molars.

content.description: Starts with a long reach to a rail then hits crimps up the bottom steep slab to a hueco finish.   Crux is between bolts 1 and 2
content.protection: Bolts. Stick clip the first bolt.
content.location: 15ft left of Bang To Rights crack. Look for lighter colored large patches of slab on the face.

content.description: Zig zag your way up to the roof and pull it (crux). Follow the leaning crack to the top.
content.location: Diagonal crack on the south side right most sharp tooth.

content.description:
Basically 3 boulder problems stacked following the seam. You get a good rest before the 3rd problem.

Bottom is techy and powerful. Top problem is the crux,  involving an undercling mono and some wild jamming.
content.location: Next route to the right of the Bang to Rights crack.

content.description: Crack on the back side of the right most tooth, opposite side from Iron Horse.

Follows pockets and big sidepulls left of the bolts, crosses back to the right through small ledges, then moves up again on pockets and sidepulls to the right of the bolts. Finishes with an awkward roof pull.
content.location: Just left of Bang To Rights.  Look for the small sidepull corner left of bolts 2 and 3.

content.description: Bolted face to the right of the Iron Horse crack.  Follow rails, crimp and pockets up to its common anchor with Iron Horse
content.location: Left of the Molars on the tooth on three right side of the gap.  Scramble up to ledge to start the route

content.description: Get to the jug handle after a big move from the ground.  Layback the crack then head to the right following great pockets that end to soon.  Thin mantle and tip toes get you to the anchors.
content.location: Center of the molars.  Long crack/seam with a dihedral at the bottom.

content.description: Starts steep on the giant hoop jug and punches up and right through sidepulls and crimps. Gets really juggy after the second bolt.
content.location: Center of the Molars, look for the obvious hoop jug starting hold.
